derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin floridus, from flos, flor- 'flower'

entry.tran: 过分花哨的;过分修饰的
entry.def: If you describe something as florid, you disapprove of the fact that it is complicated and extravagant rather than plain and simple.
Someone who is florid always has a red face.

example.ex: Jacobs was a stout, florid man.
example.tran: 雅各布斯身材结实，脸色红润。

stems_affixes.value_cn: [植]过了开花期的, 已开过花的
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉+flor花+ate……的→adj.[植]过了开花期的, 已开过花的
flor花+id如……的→像花→像花一样的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 摘花, 夺美, 玷污, 蹂躏处女
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉+flor花+ation表名词→去掉花→摘花
flor花+a表示复数→花群→植物群

stems_affixes.value_cn: 开花, 全盛期, 花期

stems_affixes.word_buile: flori=flor花+culture栽培→n.花艺, 栽培花卉
flacc松开+id如……的→adj.松驰的,软弱的
flor花+id如……的→像花→像花一样的
sta站着+id如……的→adj.稳重的,沉着的
turg肿大+id如……的→adj.浮肿的,浮夸的

sentences.en: Tears were flowing over his florid face.

sentences.en: Years of heavy drinking had given Alison a florid complexion.
